alert.note: Alert for Huntingdon; Juniata; Mifflin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 11:24PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Huntingdon, Juniata and Mifflin. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1121 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain has begun to exit the warned area. Lighter rain is expected for the next hour or two. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in spots. Expect any minor flooding to continue. - Additional rainfall should be less than a half of an inch tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntingdon, Mount Union, Raystown Dam, McConnellstown, Mapleton, Mill Creek, Kistler, Newton Hamilton, Atkinson Mills, Shirleysburg, Cassville and Juniata College. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
